messages.message:
I’m having issues with a worker dying (`WorkerLostError`) while running a flow on a 1-page document with Marx and with my line detection enabled (it is ran - part of creating a converted image).

my error looks like this:
```[2020-03-09 13:51:31,362: WARNING/ForkPoolWorker-5] DEBUGGING: Inside image_filters.find_lines()
[2020-03-09 13:51:35,006: ERROR/MainProcess] Process 'ForkPoolWorker-5' pid:15197 exited with 'signal 11 (SIGSEGV)'
[2020-03-09 13:51:35,022: ERROR/MainProcess] Chord callback for '89e58276-21a3-4162-8d37-a4f994520ed8' raised: ChordError("Dependency a36cb060-f74a-4d71-abe3-41ad0af697d2 raised WorkerLostError('Worker exited prematurely: signal 11 (SIGSEGV).')")
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/felicia/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/billiard/pool.py", line 1267, in mark_as_worker_lost
    human_status(exitcode)),
billiard.exceptions.WorkerLostError: Worker exited prematurely: signal 11 (SIGSEGV).

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/felicia/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/celery/backends/redis.py", line 399, in on_chord_part_return
    callback.delay([unpack(tup, decode) for tup in resl])
  File "/Users/felicia/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/celery/backends/redis.py", line 399, in <listcomp>
    callback.delay([unpack(tup, decode) for tup in resl])
  File "/Users/felicia/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/celery/backends/redis.py", line 352, in _unpack_chord_result
    raise ChordError('Dependency {0} raised {1!r}'.format(tid, retval))
celery.exceptions.ChordError: Dependency a36cb060-f74a-4d71-abe3-41ad0af697d2 raised WorkerLostError('Worker exited prematurely: signal 11 (SIGSEGV).')
[2020-03-09 13:51:35,023: ERROR/MainProcess] Task handler raised error: WorkerLostError('Worker exited prematurely: signal 11 (SIGSEGV).')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/felicia/instabase/venv3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/billiard/pool.py", line 1267, in mark_as_worker_lost
    human_status(exitcode)),
billiard.exceptions.WorkerLostError: Worker exited prematurely: signal 11 (SIGSEGV).```
would anybody have an idea what might have happened here? (cc @shaunak @lydia)
I don’t have this issue when running a flow with Marx without my `find_lines` enabled
